conbody.p:
A non-conformance occurs when a serial number or material lot does not meet the specification or requirement of a process, system, internal policies and procedures, customer requirements, and regulatory body. The application in the enables you to:
Select a disposition action to define a detailed disposition plan.
Keep record of non-conformities and the corrective actions taken to address them. The non-conforming parts are in the form of a defect created in the application in the .

The application tracks parts based on a serial number included in the defect. After an operator creates a defect on an operation for a Production Unit, the associated serial number and operation are placed on hold in the application, and the operators working on that associated serial number are clocked off. You can then access the defect details in the application, and then select a disposition plan for the defect.

section.title: Disposition of Defects
section.p: A disposition is an action taken to resolve non-conformance. The disposition method you select for a defect in the application determines the disposition plan for the defect.

A disposition plan includes the disposition, a description of the corrective actions to be taken (by using an action tree), and the additional instructions to be followed to address the non-conformity. You configure a disposition action reason tree in the Plant Applications Administrator, and then you use a script file to link the disposition action reason tree for selection in the application.

The disposition method that you select in the application is described in the following table.
DispositionEffect
Use as isThe non-conforming part is acceptable for being used as is.
Continue to processThe non-conforming part can undergo other operations and defect can be addressed after completion of those operations.
ClearThe non-conforming part does not require any corrective action and is considered as not a defect.
ScrapThe non-conforming part cannot be used and should be disposed.
ReworkThe non-conforming part can be used after rework.
For more information, refer to the topic.
